intro: Impatiens ambahatrensis, commonly known as the Ambahatrena Impatiens, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Balsaminaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically come in shades of pink and white. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is often found in humid forest understories, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
